text:
A Moment of Reflection

A dim street corner, Raskolnikov alone.  
He feels a storm brewing inside.  
Raskolnikov: “He has taken my twenty copecks!”  

Raskolnikov: “Why did I even interfere?”  
Raskolnikov: “Let them devour each other alive.”  

---

A deserted bench, Raskolnikov sits in despair.  
Thoughts swirl like shadows in his mind.  
Raskolnikov: “Poor girl! She will weep.”  

Raskolnikov: “Her mother will find out…”  
Raskolnikov: “Then the hospital, the taverns…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on the tragic fate of a girl he feels powerless to help, contemplating the cycle of despair that ensnares her.
